lead_paragraph: Connecticut legislators announced a compromise that will allow UConn to play a six-game series with Notre Dame, even though none of the games will be played in Connecticut. UConn and Notre Dame had been negotiating a 10-game series. The Fighting Irish wanted five games played in South Bend, Ind., and the five UConn home games played at large stadiums in the New York or Boston metropolitan areas — not at the Huskies’ 40,000-seat Rentschler Field.
